maml:description.maml:para: Exports XML to a writer, stream, file or a string.
The Export-Xml provides options for formatting and exporting XML as text to writers, streams, files and strings.
The XML node to be exported.
Export the XML to a file at the specified path.
If the parent directory does not exist, it will not be created and the command will fail.
Specifies a set of features to support on the XmlWriter object.
If other feature parameters are combined with this, properties of this object won't be changed, since a modified clone of this object is what will be used when creating the XmlWriter.
Overwrite the existing XML file if it already exists.
If this is not present, and the file exist, the command will fail.
Do not write an XML declaration.
How to handle newline characters.
Character string to use for line breaks.
The default is to use [System.Environment]::NewLine.
Remove duplicate namespace declarations when writing XML content.
The default behavior is for the writer to output all namespace declarations that are present in the writer's namespace resolver.
Text encoding to use.
This is ignored if Writing to a TextWriter and the TextWriter.Encoding property is set. Otherwise, the default is utf-8 without BOM.
Do not escape URI attributes.
Whether to check that output is a well-formed XML 1.0 document or fragment.
Do not check that characters are in the legal XML character set, as defined by W3C.
Do not add closing tags to unclosed elements when the XmlWriter.Close() method is called.
The XML node to be exported.
Export the XML to a file at the specified path.
If the parent directory does not exist, it will not be created and the command will fail.
Specifies a set of features to support on the XmlWriter object.
If other feature parameters are combined with this, properties of this object won't be changed, since a modified clone of this object is what will be used when creating the XmlWriter.
Overwrite the existing XML file if it already exists.
If this is not present, and the file exist, the command will fail.
Do not write an XML declaration.
How to handle newline characters.
Character string to use for line breaks.
The default is to use [System.Environment]::NewLine.
Remove duplicate namespace declarations when writing XML content.
The default behavior is for the writer to output all namespace declarations that are present in the writer's namespace resolver.
Text encoding to use.
This is ignored if Writing to a TextWriter and the TextWriter.Encoding property is set. Otherwise, the default is utf-8 without BOM.
Do not escape URI attributes.
Whether to check that output is a well-formed XML 1.0 document or fragment.
Do not check that characters are in the legal XML character set, as defined by W3C.
Do not add closing tags to unclosed elements when the XmlWriter.Close() method is called.
Indent elements.
Character string to use when indenting. The default is two spaces.
Write attributes on individual lines.
The XML node to be exported.
Export the XML to a file represented by a FileInfo object.
If the parent directory does not exist, it will not be created and the command will fail.

The XML node to be exported.
Return the exported XML as a string.
If multiple XML nodes are provided, the resulting string will be combined xml fragment containing the exported nodes.

CloudFileShare object indicated the share where the files/directories would be listed.
Path to an existing file/directory.
Run cmdlet in the background
The client side maximum execution time for each request in seconds.
Force close all File handles.
The total amount of concurrent async tasks. The default value is 10.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Return the count of closed file handles.
List handles Recursively. Only works on File Directory.
The server time out for each request in seconds.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
CloudFileDirectory object indicated the base folder where the files/directories would be listed.

Specifies a name or name pattern, which can be used for a wildcard search. If no blob name is specified, the cmdlet lists all the blobs in the specified container. If a value is specified for this parameter, the cmdlet lists all blobs with names that match this parameter. This parameter supports wildcards anywhere in the string.

command:example.maml:title: -------------- Example 1: Get a blob by blob name --------------

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command uses a blob name and wildcard to get a blob.
